englishTranslationText: The	event	that	terrifies	the	hearts!
romanUrduTranslationText: Dil	dahlāne	wāli.

englishTranslationText: What	is	the	event	that	terrifies	the	hearts?
romanUrduTranslationText: Kyā	woh	dahlāne	wāli.

englishTranslationText:
And	what	have	you	understood,	what	the	
event	that	terrifies	the	hearts	is!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	tu	ne	kyā	jānā	kyā	hai	dahlāne	wāli

englishTranslationText:
The	day	when	men	will	be	like	scattered	
moths.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jis	din	ādmi	hoñ	ge	jaise	phaile	patange

englishTranslationText: And	mountains	will	be	like	flying	wool
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	pahārd	hoñge	jaise	dhunki	(dhuni	
huyi)	oon

englishTranslationText: So	for	one	whose	scales	prove	heavy,
romanUrduTranslationText: To	jis	ki	tauleñ	bhāri	hoyiñ

englishTranslationText: He	is	therefore	in	the	desired	bliss
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	to	man	mānte	‘aish	meiñ	haiñ

englishTranslationText: And	for	one	whose	scales	prove	light,
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jis	ki	tauleñ	halki	padiñ

englishTranslationText: He	is	in	the	lap	of	one	that	abases.
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	neechā	dikhāne	wāli	god	meiñ	hai

englishTranslationText:
And	what	have	you	understood,	what	the	
one	that	abases	is!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tu	ne	kyā	jānā	kyā	neechā	dikhāne	
wāli.

englishTranslationText: A	flaming	fire!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aik	āg	sho’ale	mārti

englishTranslationText: The	craving	for	excess	wealth	kept	you	people	neglectful.
romanUrduTranslationText: Tumheñ	ghāfil	rakhā	māl	ki	ziyāda	ṭalabi	ne

englishTranslationText: Until	you	confronted	the	graves.
romanUrduTranslationText: Yahāñ	tak	ke	tum	ne	qabroñ	kā	muñh	dekhā

englishTranslationText: Yes	certainly,	you	will	soon	realise!
romanUrduTranslationText: Hāñ	hāñ	jald	jān	jāo	ge

englishTranslationText: Again,	yes	certainly,	you	will	soon	realise!
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	hāñ	hāñ	jald	jān	jāo	ge

englishTranslationText: Yes	certainly,	if	you	had	believed	with	certainty,	you	would	not	have	craved	for	wealth
romanUrduTranslationText: Hāñ	hāñ	agar	yaqeen	jānna	jānte	to	māl	ki	muḥabbat	na	rakhte

englishTranslationText: Indeed	you	will	see	hell.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	zaroor	Jahannam	ko	dekho	ge.

englishTranslationText: Again,	indeed	you	will	see	it	with	certainty.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	be-shak	zaroor	usey	yaqeeni	dekhnā	dekho	ge.

englishTranslationText: Then,	on	that	day,	you	will	surely	be	questioned	regarding	the	favours.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	be-shak	zaror	us	din	tum	se	ne’matoñ	se	pursish	hogi

englishTranslationText:
By	oath	of	this	era	of	yours	(O	dear	Prophet	
Muhammad	–	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	
him).
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	Zamāna-e-Meḥbob	ki	qasam

englishTranslationText: Indeed	man	is	surely	in	a	loss.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	ādmi	zaroor	nuqsān	meiñ	hai

arabicText: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلصَّبْرِ
englishTranslationText:
Except	those	who	accepted	faith,	and	did	
good	deeds	and	urged	one	another	to	the	
truth	-	and	urged	one	another	to	have	
patience.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Magar	jo	Imān	lāye	aur	achche	kām	kiye	
aur	aik	doosre	ko	ḥaq	ki	tākeed	ki	aur	aik	
doosre	ko	sabr	ki	wasiyyat	ki

englishTranslationText:
Ruin	is	for	every	open	slanderer,	
backbiter.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kharābi	hai	us	ke	liye	jo	logoñ	ke	muñh	par	
‘aib	kare	peeth	peeche	badi	kare.

englishTranslationText:
Who	accumulated	wealth	and	hoarded	it,	
counting.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jis	ne	māl	jodā	aur	gin	gin	kar	rakhā.

englishTranslationText:
Does	he	think	that	his	wealth	will	prolong	
his	stay	on	earth	forever?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	ye	samajhtā	hai	ke	us	kā	māl	usey	
duniyā	meiñ	hamesh	rakhe	gā

englishTranslationText:
Never!	He	will	certainly	be	thrown	into	the	
Crushing	One.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Hargiz	nahiñ	zaroor	woh	roñdne	wāli	meiñ	
phekā	jāye	gā

englishTranslationText:
And	what	have	you	understood	what	the	
Crushing	One	is!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	tu	ne	kyā	jānā	kyā	roñdne	wāli?

englishTranslationText: The	fire	of	Allah,	that	is	ablaze.
romanUrduTranslationText: Allāh	ki	āg	ki	bhadak	rahi	hai

englishTranslationText: Which	will	climb	on	to	the	hearts.
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	jo	diloñ	par	chardh	jāyegi

englishTranslationText: Indeed	it	will	be	shut	over	them.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	woh	un	par	band	kar	di	jāyegi

englishTranslationText: In	extended	columns.
romanUrduTranslationText: Lambe	lambe	sutoonoñ	meiñ

arabicText: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِأَصْحَـٰبِ ٱلْفِيلِ
englishTranslationText:
O	dear	Prophet	(Muhammad	-	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	did	you	not	see	how	did	your	
Lord	deal	with	the	People	of	the	Elephant?
romanUrduTranslationText: Aey	Meḥboob	Kyā	tum	ne	na	dekhā	tumhāre	Rab	ne	un	hāthi	wāloñ	kā	kyā	ḥāl	kiyā

englishTranslationText: Did	He	not	put	their	scheme	into	ruin?
romanUrduTranslationText: Kyā	un	kā	dāoñ	tabāhi	meiñ	na	dālā.

englishTranslationText: And	send	flocks	of	birds	upon	them,
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	un	par	parindoñ	ki	tukdiyāñ	(faujeñ)	bhejiñ

englishTranslationText: Which	hit	them	with	stones	of	baked	clay,
romanUrduTranslationText: Ke	unheñ	kankar	ke	paththroñ	se	mārte

englishTranslationText: So	He	made	them	like	the	leftover	devoured	leaves	of	farms?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	unheñ	kar	dālā	jaise	khāyi	kheti	ki	patti	(bhoosa)

englishTranslationText: For	giving	inclination	to	the	Quraish.
romanUrduTranslationText: Is	liye	ke	Quraish	ko	mail	dilāyā.

englishTranslationText:
The	inclination	during	both	their	travels	of	
winter	and	summer.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	ke	jārde	aur	garmi	donoñ	ke	kooch	
meiñ	mail	dilāyā	(raghbat	dilāyi)

englishTranslationText:
So	they	must	worship	the	Lord	of	this	
House.	(The	Ka’aba)
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	unheñ	chāhiye	us	ghar	ke	Rab	ki	
bandagi	kareñ.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِىٓ أَطْعَمَهُم مِّن جُوعٍۢ وَءَامَنَهُم مِّنْ خَوْفٍۭ
englishTranslationText:
The	One	Who	gave	them	food	in	hunger,	and	
bestowed	them	safety	from	a	great	fear.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jis	ne	unheñ	bhook	meiñ	khānā	diyā	aur	
unheñ	aik	bade	khauf	se	amān	bakhshā.

englishTranslationText: Just	look	at	him,	who	belies	the	religion!
romanUrduTranslationText: Bhalā	dekho	to	jo	Deen	ko	jhutlātā	hai

englishTranslationText: So	it	is	he,	who	pushes	away	the	orphan,
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	woh,	woh	hai	jo	yateem	ko	dhakke	
detā	hai

englishTranslationText: And	does	not	urge	to	feed	the	needy.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	miskeen	ke	khānā	dene	ki	raghbat	
nahiñ	detā

englishTranslationText: So	ruin	is	to	those	offerers	of	prayer	-
romanUrduTranslationText: To	un	Namāziyoñ	ki	kharābi	hai

englishTranslationText: Those	who	are	neglectful	of	their	prayer.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jo	apni	Namāz	se	bhoole	baithe	haiñ

englishTranslationText: Those	who	make	a	display	(of	their	deeds).
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	jo	dikhāwa	kartey	haiñ

englishTranslationText: And	do	not	let	others	ask	for	small	utilities.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	baratne	ki	cheez	mañge	nahiñ	dete

englishTranslationText:
We	have	indeed	bestowed	the	Kausar*	upon	you	(O	dear	prophet	Muhammad	-	peace	and	
blessings	be	upon	him).	(*Infinite	excellent	qualities	/	the	greatest	number	of	followers	/	the	sweet	
pond	on	the	Day	of	Resurrection)
romanUrduTranslationText: Aey	Meḥboob	Be-shak	ham	ne	tumheñ	be	shumār	khoobiyāñ	‘aṭā	farmāyiñ

englishTranslationText: So	offer	the	prayers	for	your	Lord,	and	perform	the	sacrifice.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	tum	apne	Rab	ke	liye	Namāz	pardho	aur	Qurbāni	karo

englishTranslationText: Indeed	it	is	your	enemy	who	is	bereft	of	all	goodness
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	jo	tumhārā	dushman	hai	wohi	har	khair	se	maḥroom	hai.

englishTranslationText:
Proclaim,	(O	dear	prophet	Muhammad	-	
peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	“O	
disbelievers!”
romanUrduTranslationText: Tum	farmāo	aey	kāfiro

englishTranslationText: Neither	do	I	worship	what	you	worship.
romanUrduTranslationText: Na	maiñ	poojtā	hooñ	jo	tum	poojte	ho.

englishTranslationText: Nor	do	you	worship	Whom	I	worship.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	na	tum	poojte	ho	jo	maiñ	poojtā	hooñ.

englishTranslationText:
And	neither	will	I	ever	worship	what	you	
worship.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	na	maiñ	poojuñ	gā	jo	tum	ne	poojā.

englishTranslationText: Nor	will	you	worship	Whom	I	worship.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	na	tum	poojo	ge	jo	maiñ	poojtā	huñ.

englishTranslationText: For	you	is	your	religion,	and	for	me	is	mine.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tumheiñ	tumhārā	deen	aur	mujhe	merā	
Deen.

englishTranslationText: When	the	help	and	victory	of	Allah	come,
romanUrduTranslationText: Jab	Allāh	ki	Madad	aur	Fataḥ	āye

arabicText: وَرَأَيْتَ ٱلنَّاسَ يَدْخُلُونَ فِى دِينِ ٱللَّهِ أَفْوَاجًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	you	see	people	entering	the	religion	of	
Allah	in	multitudes,
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	logoñ	ko	tum	dekho	ke	Allāh	ke	Deen	
meiñ	fauj	fauj	dākhil	hote	haiñ

arabicText: فَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ وَٱسْتَغْفِرْهُ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ تَوَّابًۢا
englishTranslationText:
Then	proclaim	the	Purity	of	your	Lord	
while	praising	Him,	and	seek	forgiveness	
from	Him;	indeed	He	is	the	Most	Acceptor	
of	Repentance.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	apne	Rab	ki	sanā	karte	huye	us	ki	pāki	
bolo	aur	us	se	bakhshish	chāho Be-shak	
woh	bahut	tauba	qubool	karne	wālā	hai.

englishTranslationText: May	both	the	hands	of	Abu	Lahab	be	destroyed	–	and	he	is	destroyed!
romanUrduTranslationText: Tabāh	ho	jāyeñ	Abu	Lahab	ke	donoñ	hāth	aur	woh	tabāh	ho	hi	gayā

arabicText: مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُ مَالُهُۥ وَمَا كَسَبَ
englishTranslationText: His	wealth	did	not	benefit	him	in	the	least,	nor	did	whatever	he	earned.
romanUrduTranslationText: Usey	kuch	kām	na	āayā	us	kā	māl	aur	na	jo	kamāyā

englishTranslationText: He	will	soon	enter	the	flaming	fire.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ab	dhañstā	hai	lapat	mārti	āg	meiñ	woh.

englishTranslationText: And	so	will	his	wife;	carrying	a	bundle	of	firewood	on	her	head.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	us	ki	joru	lakdiyoñ	kā	gath-thā	sar	par	uthāye.

englishTranslationText: A	rope	made	from	palm	fibre	around	her	neck!
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	ke	gale	meiñ	khajoor	ki	chāl	kā	rassā

englishTranslationText:
Proclaim	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	
peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	“He	is	
Allah,	He	is	One.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Tum	farmāo	woh	Allāh	hai	woh	aik	hai

englishTranslationText:
“Allah	is	the	Un-wanting.”	(Perfect,	does	
not	require	anything.)
romanUrduTranslationText: Allāh	be-niyāz	hai

englishTranslationText:
“He	has	no	offspring,	nor	is	He	born	from	
anything.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Na	us	ki	koyi	aulād	aur	na	woh	kisi	se	paidā	
huā

englishTranslationText: “And	there	is	none	equal	to	Him.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	na	us	ke	jord	kā	koyi

englishTranslationText:
Proclaim	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	–	
peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	“I	take	
refuge	of	the	One	Who	creates	the	
Daybreak.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	maiñ	us	ki	panāh	letā	huñ	jo	
subḥ	kā	paidā	karne	wālā	hai

englishTranslationText: “From	the	evil	of	His	entire	creation.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	ki	sab	makhlooq	ke	shar	se

englishTranslationText:
“And	from	the	evil	of	the	matter	that	
darkens	when	it	sets.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	andheri	dālne	wāle	ke	shar	se	jab	woh	
doobe

englishTranslationText:
“And	from	the	evil	of	the	witches	who	blow	
into	knots.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	‘auratoñ	ke	shar	se	jo	girhoñ	meiñ	
phooñkti	haiñ

englishTranslationText:
“And	from	the	evil	of	the	envier	when	he	is	
envious	of	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ḥasad	wāle	ke	shar	se	jab	woh	mujh	se	
jale

englishTranslationText:
Proclaim	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	–	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	“I	take	refuge	of	the	
One	Who	is	the	Lord	of	all	mankind.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Tum	kaho,	“Main	Us	ki	panāh	meiñ	āayā	jo	sab	logoñ	kā	Rab”

englishTranslationText: “The	King	of	all	mankind.”
romanUrduTranslationText: “Sab	logoñ	kā	Bādshāh”

englishTranslationText: “The	God	of	all	mankind.”
romanUrduTranslationText: “Sab	logoñ	kā	Khudā”

englishTranslationText: “From	the	evil	of	the	one	who	instils	evil	thoughts	in	the	hearts	–	and	stays	hidden.”
romanUrduTranslationText: “Us	ke	shar	se	jo	dil	meiñ	bure	khaṭre	dāle	aur	dabak	rahe”

englishTranslationText: “Those	who	instil	evil	thoughts	into	the	hearts	of	men.”
romanUrduTranslationText: “Woh	jo	logoñ	ke	diloñ	meiñ	waswase	dālte	haiñ”.

englishTranslationText: “Among	the	jinns	and	men.”
romanUrduTranslationText: “Jin	aur	Āadmi”
